description:
Kelly L Andersen and his team provide first rate legal service to people injured or killed by the negligent, careless, or wrongful acts of others. Mr Andersen has been a trial attorney for 27 years and has handled thousands of personal injury cases, having collected from insurance companies and corporations approximately $50 million dollars of behalf on his clients.

The law firm has Oregon offices in Medford (Jackson County), Grants Pass (Josephine County), and Klamath Falls (Klamath County). The firm also has represented clients in Washington, California, Hawaii and other states.

Mr. Andersen's practice includes (but is not limited to) claims arising from:

  • Wrongful Death
  • Dangerous or Defective Products
  • Vehicle Collisions
    - Automobiles
    - Motorcycles
    - Semi-Tractor/Trailer
    - Bicycles
    - Pedestrians
  • Medical/Legal Malpractice
  • Insurance Claims for Bodily Injuries
  • Uninsured Motorists
  • Under-insured Motorists
  • Premises Liability
  • Slip and Fall
  • Concealed Hazards
  • Dog Bites
  • Sexual Abuse
  • Elder Abuse

Mr. Andersen has been a trial attorney for 27 years and has handled a wide variety of personal injury and wrongful death cases. Whether the injury is modest, major, or catastrophic, each case receives his devoted attention and service. He understands that a serious injury often results in devastating consequences for an individual and his or her family. Mr. Andersen provides his clients with aggressive and dedicated legal representation, while at the same time showing genuine courtesy and respect.

The law firm of Anderson, Morse & Linthorst, a Professional Corporation, is highly respected in the legal community, receiving many referrals from prior clients, insurance adjusters, defense attorneys, retired judges and community doctors. Mr. Andersen is passionate about attending legal education seminars, each year spending many more hours in continuing legal education than the law requires. Mr. Andersen has published a number of scholarly articles, and stays current in knowing new laws.
